WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: Shawlands Farm Forum
Address: Lipton, Sask.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1904
Where did you set up housekeeping? McDonald Hills, Assiniboia
Where had you been living before that? England
For how many people did you prepare meals? 6
How far was it to your nearest store? S.C. Campbell, Sami
How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice a year
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
flour, sugar, tea, jam, sow belly, salt, yeast cakes, tobacco, coal oil, Royal Crown Soap, Sulphur Matches

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Five Roses
In what quantities did you buy it? 50 lbs., 100 lbs.
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $1.50
How much did you use graham flour?
Whole wheat flour?
Was flour milled locally? No
How far away? ______ What year? ______
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? ______
What other grain products did you use? Corn meal, rice
Cornmeal? ______ Whole wheat? ______ Farina? ______
Other? ______
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes
How did you grind it? Coffee mill, hand grinder

4. DAIRY PRODUCTS

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days? Dairy Cows.

Butter? Homemade. Eggs? Off the farm flock.

What was the price of butter? $0.50. Eggs?

Did you pack eggs for winter? Yes. How? Cans.

Did you make butter? Yes. Cheese? Yes.

What kind of cheese? Renish Cheese & Cottage.

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? Pork and wild game, chicken, duck, rabbit.

How did you get fresh meat? Killed & dressed.

How often did you get fresh meat? Hunted it.

How did you preserve meat? Salt.

Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood? Yes (1917).

If so what year was it organized? 1918.

Did you use game? Yes. What kinds? Chicken, duck, rabbit.

For how long? 1920.

What part did fish play in the family diet? Little.

Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? Fresh when procurable.

Kinds? Suckers. (Spring drive up the creek.)

20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

Everything had to be cooked from the basic materials while now many things can be bought partially prepared.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homestead and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

We still use home produced foods for the main staples.
